messages.subject: lawyers and inter-state problems
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/27/02 7:23:48 AM, Tuckervill@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/27/02 7:23:48 AM, Tuckervill@... writes:

<< Sandra, maybe you won't have to actually sue. Someone in Columbia should
really go take pictures of that ramp, still wet I'm sure, after all these
days. Then what I would do is get a lawyer to write a demand letter,
demanding that they pay your expenses and fix the ramp. >>

Oh yes. That was going to be the other letter.

Thanks to Priss1000, I have photos of me on the ramp, and it's clear that I
fell way before the puddle. My foot doesn't even reach it. And you can see
the really steep angle of the ramp too.

So I want to write to the city inspector, and to the hotel, asking if they
have fixed that ramp and if they intend to, and depending on the responses I
get, I'll either be sweet and reasonable, or I'll have a lawyer.

How does it work, with me in one state and them in another, as lawyers go?

Sandra
